jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer/Technical Lead (Hyrbid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?

📍Your Impact Starts Here

As a Senior Software Engineer on the Distribution team based in Denver, you will tackle challenging, novel situations every day and work just as nicely. You will be involved in designing and building key components of our product platform while working closely with a dynamic technical team. The role demands bold innovation and obsession with quality and customer experience.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • Develop comprehensive frontend and backend solutions integrating seamlessly into our broader service architecture.

  • Lead and participate in critical technical, design, and product discussions with leaders across our engineering and product teams.

  • Mentor junior engineers, providing guidance and feedback to help grow their technical skillsets.

  • Innovate and implement new technologies to enhance application performance and development efficiency.

  • Collaborate with team members to define, design, and ship new features in a fast-paced environment.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related fiel,d or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.

  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in software development with a proven track record in full-stack development.

  • Strong hands-on experience with JavaScript, CSS, and frameworks/tools like React, Node.js, and webpack.

  • Excellent understanding of server-side languages such as Ruby, Python, or Java.

  • Strong partner-facing capabilities.

  • Tech leadership skills, with a proven ability to handle complex technical projects independently.

  • Fluency using AI to build, learn, and work faster — experimenting with tools, retooling workflows, and sharing those wins with your team.

  • Ability to delegate tasks and mentor junior team members effectively.

  • A commitment to writing understandable, maintainable, and reusable software.

  • Effectiveness in implementing scalable software solutions.

  • Success in mentoring and leading projects within time constraints.

  • Contribution to the continuous improvement and innovation at Homebase.

  • Excellent analytical and time management skills.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

🤝 The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer

  • 💰 Ownership & Financial Security: Stock options + 401(k) with 4% match

  • 🏥 Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, dental, and vision coverage + FSA options

  • ⏰ Flexible Time: Unlimited PTO (salaried) + company holidays

  • 👶 Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service)

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Mavel W.

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Kristen S.

  • Participate in a Talent Showcase

  • Meet Cross-functional Partners

  • Background Check + Offer Stage

  • Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply!

Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

👋 Hey, We’re Homebase

Unstoppable teams start here.

Homebase is the everything app for hourly teams—built to simplify the day-to-day and superpower local businesses. With tools for scheduling, time clocks, payroll, communication, HR, and more, we help teams stay connected and in control. Today, over 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses rely on us to make work radically easier. Together, we’ve tracked over a billion hours for 2.5+ million workers—and we’re just getting started.

At Homebase, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all candidates and do not discriminate based on any legally protected status. If you need accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know—we’re committed to ensuring fair and equitable access for all.

jobs.title: Future Opportunities with G&A
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie! At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app. We’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?

This posting is part of our G&A teams talent pool. It’s not linked to a specific open role—but if you're excited about Homebase and want to be considered for future roles on our Marketing, Finance, People, Legal, and Operations teams, we’d love to hear from you.

📍Your Impact Starts Here
Even if you don’t see a current opening that matches your background, we still want to hear from you. This is your opportunity to submit your resume for future consideration across our G&A teams, including Marketing, Finance, People, Legal, and Operations. Our Talent team regularly reviews submissions to this job post and will reach out if there's a match with an upcoming opportunity.


Key Ways You Could Make an Impact:

  • Shape brand and go-to-market strategies that connect with local business owners

  • Optimize and scale internal systems and processes for a growing company

  • Tell the Homebase story through people, analytics, content, or compliance

  • Support a strong, inclusive culture and a high-performing team experience

🚀 The Foundation for Success - We’re always looking for people who:

  • Are driven by impact and innovation

  • Value high standards, fast learning, and real-world execution

  • Thrive in a culture of feedback, ownership, and collaboration

  • Are passionate about making work better for local business teams

  • Are ready to work in the office weekly if your role is hybrid (typically Tuesdays and Wednesdays)

🧠 AI at Homebase
We’re an AI-first company, and that includes every team. Whether you’re streamlining workflows, exploring new tools, or coaching others—AI fluency is expected across all roles. At Homebase, we use AI to move faster, make smarter decisions, and reimagine how work gets done. As part of our Talent Pool, you’re someone who’s excited to experiment, learn, and unlock impact with the help of AI.

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

💜 Belonging at Homebase
We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms. So if you're excited about the possibility of working with us, even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

📍Your Impact Starts Here
Even if you don’t see a current opening that matches your background, we still want to hear from you. jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer I/II (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team. We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?

You’ll join the Schedule Builder (SB) and Human Resource Management (HRM) domain, which together power how small business managers manage their people and their schedules. HRM focuses on everything about a business’s team at a given location—who they are, what they do, and how they grow. SB drives how those teams are staffed, how shifts are created, and how AI helps business owners manage time more efficiently.

📍 Your Impact Starts Here

We're looking for a Senior Full-stack Engineer to own critical product work on our Human Resource Management (HRM) platform. You'll build employee-facing experiences that small businesses rely on daily— team roster, compliance, HR, and onboarding—and help evolve our Rails + React architecture for the next phase of growth.

This is a senior IC role with informal technical leadership. You'll drive projects end-to-end, mentor engineers through pairing and design reviews, and collaborate closely with product, design, and data science to ship features that eliminate busywork for our customers.

If you love solving real-world problems with craftsmanship and speed, and you're energized by using AI to work faster and smarter, we want to hear from you.

  • Own end-to-end delivery – Lead projects from technical design through production for the HRM domain, working across Rails services and modern React (TypeScript) frontends.

  • Write production code – You're hands-on across the stack: Ruby, Rails, React, Postgres. You debug performance issues, refactor legacy code, and ship clean, testable features.

  • Shape technical direction – Partner with the Engineers, PM, and Designer to make architecture decisions. Participate in critical design discussions with engineering and product leadership.

  • Mentor and raise the bar – Guide engineers through code reviews, pairing sessions, and technical feedback. Help the team level up on patterns, testing, and system design.

  • Build with AI – Use AI coding assistants (Cursor, Claude) daily to move faster. Build features that integrate AI capabilities where they make sense (e.g., intelligent scheduling, workflow automation).

  • Collaborate cross-functionally – Work with data teams to productionize models, coordinate with platform teams on shared infrastructure, and align with other domain teams (SB, CE, and more) on cross-cutting initiatives.

🚀 The Foundation for Success – These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 5+ years of professional software engineering experience, with at least 3 years working full-stack in Ruby on Rails and modern frontend frameworks (React, or similar).

  • Strong track record of shipping complex features end-to-end with measurable customer impact. You have solid product sense and understand how to balance speed with quality.

  • Deep technical strength in performance/scalability and production debugging across the stack—database queries, service architecture, and frontend optimization.

  • You're comfortable using AI coding assistants (Cursor, Claude, or similar) in your daily workflow and excited to experiment with new tools that improve efficiency.

  • You've helped other engineers grow through pairing, design reviews, or technical feedback. You enjoy teaching and raising the bar for the team.

  • TypeScript experience preferred.

🤝 The Homie Way

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

This is a senior IC role with informal technical leadership. You'll drive projects end-to-end, mentor engineers through pairing and design reviews, and collaborate closely with product, design, and data science to ship features that eliminate busywork for our customers.

If you love solving real-world problems with craftsmanship and speed, and you're energized by using AI to work faster and smarter, we want to hear from you.

 - Own end-to-end delivery – Lead projects from technical design through production for the HRM domain, working across Rails services and modern React (TypeScript) frontends.

jobs.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a strategic, data-driven Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead go-to-market efforts for Hiring Assistant, one of Homebase’s most ambitious product lines. This AI-powered product is not only a new front door for net-new customer acquisition, but a key driver of higher customer lifetime value (LTV) and cross-product adoption.

As our Hiring Assistant PMM, you’ll help define our ideal customer segments, develop sharp positioning and messaging, and execute campaigns that drive usage and conversion. You’ll collaborate with Product, Sales, and Marketing to scale this business line—and play a critical role in helping small businesses hire faster, better, and smarter.

🧠 These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • GTM Strategy & Execution: Own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy for Hiring Assistant—from positioning and messaging to launch execution and campaign optimization.

  • Customer Segmentation & Insights: Lead research to identify high-potential SMB customer segments and hiring use cases. Translate insights into actionable targeting strategies.

  • Growth Campaigns: Partner with Lifecycle, Growth, and Sales to craft integrated campaigns that drive product activation, retention, and expansion.

  • Cross-Product Attach: Work closely with Revenue and Product teams to align Hiring Assistant with broader monetization and attach strategies across Scheduling, Payroll, and HR.

  • AI-Enabled Execution: Leverage AI tools to accelerate campaign development, personalize messaging at scale, and uncover insights that inform smarter GTM decisions.

  • Data-Driven Optimization: Define success metrics, build dashboards with Analytics, and apply A/B testing and cohort analysis to continuously improve impact.

  • Sales Enablement & Content: Develop compelling collateral, pitch decks, objection handling, and training to support frontline teams.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 7+ years of experience in product marketing, growth marketing, or strategy roles—preferably in SaaS, marketplaces, or AI-powered tools.

  • Ideal fit for candidates with experience in management consulting, strategy, or analytics, and those who hold MBAs from leading programs, bringing a structured, hypothesis-driven approach to go-to-market execution.

  • Strong analytical chops—you love digging into customer data, segment behavior, and funnel performance to guide strategy and improve results.

  • Proven ability to own GTM launches, lead cross-functional initiatives, and optimize campaigns for long-term value.

  • Experience in identifying and scaling ideal customer profiles, with a strong understanding of small business needs and behavior.

  • Comfort navigating AI tools and emerging tech, with a pragmatic approach to integrating them into workflows and value props.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence across teams and executive stakeholders.

  • Experience launching or scaling AI-powered or hiring-related tools.

  • (Bonus Points) Exposure to freemium → paid product models or cross-sell strategy.

  • (Bonus Points) Previous ownership of a new product or zero-to-one GTM.

  • 🏥 Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, dental, and vision coverage + FSA options

  • ⏰ Flexible Time: Unlimited PTO (salaried) + company holidays

  • 👶 Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service)

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What We Offer (Canada)

  • 💰 Ownership & Savings: Stock options + TFSA/RRSP with 4% company match

  • 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

  • ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

  • 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesdays and Wednesdays are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

We’re looking for a Staff Product Manager, Scheduling to own and advance the full scheduling ecosystem — the tools, data, and intelligence that power how small businesses staff their teams efficiently and confidently.

You’ll lead the evolution of our Scheduling Assistant, an AI-driven system that anticipates business needs, automates staffing, and empowers owners and employees alike. But your impact goes beyond innovation: you’ll also own the quality of our core scheduling experience, ensuring we deliver reliability, usability, and delight to every customer. This is a pivotal role that blends AI product strategy, data-informed decision-making, and deep empathy for hourly teams.

You’ll partner closely with Engineering, Data Science, and Design leaders to reimagine scheduling end-to-end — defining how AI transforms the experience of running a local business. This is a Staff-level role, balancing strategic leadership, technical depth, and a hands-on approach to driving measurable, high-quality impact across one of Homebase’s most important product areas.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • Lead Scheduling Strategy: Define and execute the multi-year vision for Homebase Scheduling — cover the full customer journey from planning to dealing with last-minute changes for our owners and managers, and their employees.

  • Drive AI Innovation: Partner with Data Science to evolve our Scheduling Assistant into an intelligent co-pilot that forecasts demand, recommends staffing, and auto-builds optimal schedules.

  • Influence the Platform: Shape Homebase’s broader AI architecture and integrations by ensuring Scheduling works seamlessly with the Homebase Assistant, Time Tracking, Payroll, and Hiring.

  • Own Outcomes, Not Just Features: Define metrics that matter — utilization, staffing accuracy, adoption, and customer satisfaction — and drive measurable revenue.

  • Lead Cross-Functional Execution: Partner across Product, Design, and Engineering to deliver customer value at velocity. Mentor PMs and shape product excellence across the org.

  • Champion Our Customers: Be the voice of small business owners and hourly workers, translating their needs into solutions that are intuitive, equitable, and empowering.

  • Build for Scale: Leverage Homebase’s platform and data to build models that get smarter with every schedule created.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 8+ years of product management experience, with 3+ years driving large-scale, customer-facing products end-to-end.

  • Proven success launching intelligent or data-powered product experiences, ideally with AI, ML, or predictive systems.

  • Strong track record of leading cross-functional initiatives that blend product, design, data science, and engineering.

  • Strategic systems thinker who thrives in ambiguity and drives clarity across teams.

jobs.descriptionPlain:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Staff Product Manager, Scheduling to own and advance the full scheduling ecosystem — the tools, data, and intelligence that power how small businesses staff their teams efficiently and confidently.

You’ll lead the evolution of our Scheduling Assistant, an AI-driven system that anticipates business needs, automates staffing, and empowers owners and employees alike. But your impact goes beyond innovation: you’ll also own the quality of our core scheduling experience, ensuring we deliver reliability, usability, and delight to every customer. This is a pivotal role that blends AI product strategy, data-informed decision-making, and deep empathy for hourly teams.

You’ll partner closely with Engineering, Data Science, and Design leaders to reimagine scheduling end-to-end — defining how AI transforms the experience of running a local business. This is a Staff-level role, balancing strategic leadership, technical depth, and a hands-on approach to driving measurable, high-quality impact across one of Homebase’s most important product areas.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

 - Lead Scheduling Strategy: Define and execute the multi-year vision for Homebase Scheduling — cover the full customer journey from planning to dealing with last-minute changes for our owners and managers, and their employees.

 - Drive AI Innovation: Partner with Data Science to evolve our Scheduling Assistant into an intelligent co-pilot that forecasts demand, recommends staffing, and auto-builds optimal schedules.

 - Influence the Platform: Shape Homebase’s broader AI architecture and integrations by ensuring Scheduling works seamlessly with the Homebase Assistant, Time Tracking, Payroll, and Hiring.

 - Own Outcomes, Not Just Features: Define metrics that matter — utilization, staffing accuracy, adoption, and customer satisfaction — and drive measurable revenue.

 - Lead Cross-Functional Execution: Partner across Product, Design, and Engineering to deliver customer value at velocity. Mentor PMs and shape product excellence across the org.

 - Champion Our Customers: Be the voice of small business owners and hourly workers, translating their needs into solutions that are intuitive, equitable, and empowering.

 - Build for Scale: Leverage Homebase’s platform and data to build models that get smarter with every schedule created.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

 - 8+ years of product management experience, with 3+ years driving large-scale, customer-facing products end-to-end.

 - Proven success launching intelligent or data-powered product experiences, ideally with AI, ML, or predictive systems.

 - Strong track record of leading cross-functional initiatives that blend product, design, data science, and engineering.

 - Strategic systems thinker who thrives in ambiguity and drives clarity across teams.

 - Experience in workforce, scheduling, or operations software preferred.

 - Comfortable setting vision and diving deep — from writing strategy docs, to building prototypes, to debugging customer feedback.

 - AI Fluency: You retool workflows with AI, partner fluently with DS/ML teams, and measure AI’s business impact.

Hybrid Collaboration: Works in-office (Tues/Weds) for strategy and collaboration, and flexes remote for deep focus.

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

 - 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

 - ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

 - 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

 - 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

 - 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer (United States)

 - 💰 Ownership & Financial Security: Stock options + 401(k) with 4% match

 - 🏥 Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, dental, and vision coverage + FSA options

 - ⏰ Flexible Time: Unlimited PTO (salaried) + company holidays

 - 👶 Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service)

 - 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

 - 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

 - 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days

 - 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What We Offer (Canada)

 - 💰 Ownership & Savings: Stock options + TFSA/RRSP with 4% company match

 - 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

 - ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

 - 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

 - 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

 - 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

 - 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

 - 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

 - Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Josh D. https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshdunton/

 - Meet the Hiring Manager, Rachel S. https://www.linkedin.com/in/rachelstrubhar/

 - Participate in a Talent Showcase

 - Meet Cross-functional Partners

 - Background Check + Offer Stage

 - Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply! 

Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

👋 Hey, We’re Homebase

Unstoppable teams start here.

Homebase is the everything app for hourly teams—built to simplify the day-to-day and superpower local businesses. With tools for scheduling, time clocks, payroll, communication, HR, and more, we help teams stay connected and in control. Today, over 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses rely on us to make work radically easier. Together, we’ve tracked over a billion hours for 2.5+ million workers—and we’re just getting started.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie! At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app. We’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?

This posting is part of our Product & Design talent pool. It’s not linked to a specific open role—but if you're excited about Homebase and want to be considered for future roles on our Product or Design teams, we’d love to hear from you.

📍Your Impact Starts Here
Even if you don’t see a current opening that matches your background, we still want to hear from you. This is your opportunity to submit your resume for future consideration on our Product & Design teams. Our Talent team regularly reviews submissions to this job post and will reach out if there's a match with an upcoming opportunity.


Key Ways You Could Make an Impact:

  • Design delightful, human-first product experiences for hourly workers and small business owners

  • Drive strategy and execution across cross-functional product squads

  • Use research, prototyping, and data to deeply understand customer needs

  • Shape the future of an all-in-one platform that transforms how hourly teams work

🚀 The Foundation for Success - We’re always looking for people who:

  • Are driven by impact and innovation

  • Value high standards, fast learning, and real-world execution

  • Thrive in a culture of feedback, ownership, and collaboration

  • Are passionate about making work better for local business teams

  • Are ready to work in the office weekly if your role is hybrid (typically Tuesdays and Wednesdays)

🧠 AI at Homebase
We’re an AI-first company, and that includes every team. Whether you’re streamlining workflows, exploring new tools, or coaching others—AI fluency is expected across all roles. At Homebase, we use AI to move faster, make smarter decisions, and reimagine how work gets done. As part of our Talent Pool, you’re someone who’s excited to experiment, learn, and unlock impact with the help of AI.

jobs.title: Lead, Marketing Ops & Analytics (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Lead, Marketing Operations & Lifecycle Analytics to own our MarOps stack and the analytics that power lifecycle growth. This is both a technical and analytical leadership role: you’ll ensure data integrity, enable high-quality measurement, and uncover insights that guide strategy across the funnel. Reporting to the Head of Analytics, you’ll sit in our business enablement org while partnering daily with Growth, Lifecycle, RevOps, and Engineering.

If you love solving complex technical puzzles that unlock marketing superpowers, we want to hear from you.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in marketing operations, marketing automation, marketing analytics, or related roles in fast-moving and growing companies.

  • Passion for Analytics: You thrive on data, uncovering patterns, trends, and opportunities to optimize marketing performance. You understand how data flows across marketing systems, how to troubleshoot tracking issues, and how insights fuel growth. Intermediate knowledge of SQL is required.

  • MarTech Expertise: Deep experience with Google Tag Manager (GTM), Looker, Amplitude (or similar tools), CDPs (Amplitude CDP, Hightouch, Segment or similar), and marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot). You’re comfortable navigating CRM systems (preferably Salesforce) and integrating them with marketing tools, alongside RevOps leaders.

  • Attribution Knowledge: You have hands-on experience with data integration tools, UTM strategy, multi-touch attribution, and campaign tracking. You know how to build and refine attribution models that connect marketing efforts to leads and revenue.

  • Ad Tech Experience: Strong understanding of Google Ads, Meta CAPI, mobile measurement partners (MMPs), and first-party data strategies. You know how to ensure proper event tracking, conversion tracking, and offline event matching to optimize campaign performance and measurement.

  • Champion AI-assisted analytics & ops. Use LLMs/agents for QA, tagging, audience building, anomaly detection, insight generation, and ops automation.

  • Curiosity: You love digging into complex problems, debugging tracking issues, and finding creative solutions. You’re resourceful, fundamentally curious, and relentless in understanding the “why”.

  • Small Business Love: You earnestly care about the small business community and believe you can help our marketing program that will actually make their lives better.

Collaboration: You thrive in a cross-functional team environment and are excited to collaborate in the office weekly on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • Owning our MarTech Stack: Managing and optimizing our marketing technology ecosystem, ensuring seamless integrations, data accuracy, and scalability across ad platforms and tools like Amplitude Growth CDP, AppsGoogle Tag Manager, Iterable, Salesforce, Command AI (Amplitude G&S), and Looker.

  • Improving Tracking: Ensuring accurate event tracking, campaign tagging, and data consistency across all marketing touchpoints to provide reliable insights and performance measurement.

  • Improving Attribution Models: Developing and refining multi-touch attribution models to connect marketing efforts to pipeline, revenue, and ROI, enabling better decision-making and budget allocation.

  • Implementing New Systems & Tools: Evaluating, selecting, and integrating new MarTech solutions to enhance automation, data visibility, and marketing performance.

  • Building Marketing Automation Workflows: Designing and implementing lifecycle automation, lead nurturing sequences, and personalized workflows that improve efficiency and engagement across multiple channels.

  • Improving Ad Platform Performance: Enhancing ad tracking, offline conversions, and audience segmentation to optimize spend efficiency and performance across Google Ads, Meta CAPI, Apple Search Ads, and other paid channels.

  • AI fluency: Comfort using AI tools to accelerate analysis and operations.

  • Analyze, analyze, analyze: You’ll constantly monitor how everything is “working”, what’s good, bad, or ugly, and come prepared with ideas and solutions.

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer

  • 💰 Ownership & Savings: Stock options + TFSA/RRSP with 4% company match

  • 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

  • ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

  • 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Phollie Rose L.

jobs.descriptionPlain:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Lead, Marketing Operations & Lifecycle Analytics to own our MarOps stack and the analytics that power lifecycle growth. This is both a technical and analytical leadership role: you’ll ensure data integrity, enable high-quality measurement, and uncover insights that guide strategy across the funnel. Reporting to the Head of Analytics, you’ll sit in our business enablement org while partnering daily with Growth, Lifecycle, RevOps, and Engineering.

If you love solving complex technical puzzles that unlock marketing superpowers, we want to hear from you.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

 - Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in marketing operations, marketing automation, marketing analytics, or related roles in fast-moving and growing companies.

 - Passion for Analytics: You thrive on data, uncovering patterns, trends, and opportunities to optimize marketing performance. You understand how data flows across marketing systems, how to troubleshoot tracking issues, and how insights fuel growth. Intermediate knowledge of SQL is required.

 - MarTech Expertise: Deep experience with Google Tag Manager (GTM), Looker, Amplitude (or similar tools), CDPs (Amplitude CDP, Hightouch, Segment or similar), and marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot). You’re comfortable navigating CRM systems (preferably Salesforce) and integrating them with marketing tools, alongside RevOps leaders.

 - Attribution Knowledge: You have hands-on experience with data integration tools, UTM strategy, multi-touch attribution, and campaign tracking. You know how to build and refine attribution models that connect marketing efforts to leads and revenue.

 - Ad Tech Experience: Strong understanding of Google Ads, Meta CAPI, mobile measurement partners (MMPs), and first-party data strategies. You know how to ensure proper event tracking, conversion tracking, and offline event matching to optimize campaign performance and measurement.

 - Champion AI-assisted analytics & ops. Use LLMs/agents for QA, tagging, audience building, anomaly detection, insight generation, and ops automation.

 - Curiosity: You love digging into complex problems, debugging tracking issues, and finding creative solutions. You’re resourceful, fundamentally curious, and relentless in understanding the “why”.

 - Small Business Love: You earnestly care about the small business community and believe you can help our marketing program that will actually make their lives better.

Collaboration: You thrive in a cross-functional team environment and are excited to collaborate in the office weekly on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

 - Owning our MarTech Stack: Managing and optimizing our marketing technology ecosystem, ensuring seamless integrations, data accuracy, and scalability across ad platforms and tools like Amplitude Growth CDP, AppsGoogle Tag Manager, Iterable, Salesforce, Command AI (Amplitude G&S), and Looker.

 - Improving Tracking: Ensuring accurate event tracking, campaign tagging, and data consistency across all marketing touchpoints to provide reliable insights and performance measurement.

 - Improving Attribution Models: Developing and refining multi-touch attribution models to connect marketing efforts to pipeline, revenue, and ROI, enabling better decision-making and budget allocation.

 - Implementing New Systems & Tools: Evaluating, selecting, and integrating new MarTech solutions to enhance automation, data visibility, and marketing performance.

 - Building Marketing Automation Workflows: Designing and implementing lifecycle automation, lead nurturing sequences, and personalized workflows that improve efficiency and engagement across multiple channels.

 - Improving Ad Platform Performance: Enhancing ad tracking, offline conversions, and audience segmentation to optimize spend efficiency and performance across Google Ads, Meta CAPI, Apple Search Ads, and other paid channels.

 - AI fluency: Comfort using AI tools to accelerate analysis and operations.

 - Analyze, analyze, analyze: You’ll constantly monitor how everything is “working”, what’s good, bad, or ugly, and come prepared with ideas and solutions.

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

 - 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

 - ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

 - 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

 - 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

 - 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer

 - 💰 Ownership & Savings: Stock options + TFSA/RRSP with 4% company match

 - 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

 - ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

 - 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

 - 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

 - 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

 - 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

 - 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

 - Meet the Hiring Manager, Vlad A. https://www.linkedin.com/in/akmnko/

 - Participate in a Case Interview with a Cross-functional Panel

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Sales Enablement (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Senior Manager of Sales Enablement who’s passionate about enabling high-performing go-to-market teams. You’ll focus on accelerating performance across our customer-facing teams—from onboarding to advanced coaching. This is a unique opportunity to build and scale enablement infrastructure that directly drives revenue growth and unlocks AI-powered workflows. If you love building from zero to one, thrive in high-velocity environments, and want to shape how teams win together, we want to hear from you.

  • Build and execute enablement programs across the full customer lifecycle—from acquisition to retention and expansion

  • Own onboarding for new sales team members, decreasing ramp time, and increasing early productivity

  • Develop ongoing training for experienced reps, focused on conversion, cross-sell, and deal quality

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, RevOps, and Product to ensure content and coaching are aligned with business needs

  • Enable AI-first workflows by training GTM teams on automation tools, AI-powered pitch tools, and customer insights

  • Define and manage competency frameworks for sales roles, managers, and future GTM motions

  • Lead and grow a team of enablement specialists, content creators, and trainers

  • Measure impact and iterate programs using performance data and seller feedback

  • Support GTM evolution into new segments like franchise, channel, and mid-market

  • Continuously refine our tech stack to reinforce training through real-time guidance and system integrations

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 5+ years in revenue/sales enablement or L&D for GTM orgs; 2+ years leading teams or programs

  • Demonstrated ability to build programs that improve rep productivity and conversion

  • Fluency with enablement and sales tools (e.g., Highspot, Gong, Salesforce, Lessonly, Outreach)

  • Deep knowledge of adult learning theory, sales methodologies (MEDDICC, Challenger, etc.), and performance coaching

  • Comfort operating in a high-growth, fast-paced SaaS environment

  • Track record of integrating AI into sales or enablement processes

  • Ability to collaborate in the office weekly, Monday - Thursday

  • 👶 Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Monday-Thursday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Kristen G.

  • Meet Cross-functional Partners

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer, Growth (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?

The Growth team empowers new customers to succeed from day one. We design seamless, high-impact journeys that turn first impressions into lasting momentum—helping people unlock value quickly, confidently, and with clarity.

 📍Your Impact Starts Here 

We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer, Growth who’s passionate about helping new customers realize value—fast. You’ll focus on the early stages of the customer journey, from account creation to onboarding and activation, bringing both strategy and execution to the table. This is a unique opportunity to shape how customers experience our product from the very first interaction.. You’ll collaborate across teams to deliver real results and raise the bar every step of the way. If you love to solve ambiguous problems, define experiments, and make a measurable impact, we want to hear from you.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • Lead and execute initiatives and experiments that accelerate activation, improve time to value, and improve conversion in the first 30 days

  • Partner with product, engineering, customer success, and marketing to deliver seamless, intuitive experiences across web and mobile

  • Champion a test-and-learn culture across teams, ensuring fast learning and iteration on the highest-impact problems

  • Take initiative in identifying, shaping, and driving end-to-end experiments—from hypothesis to execution—with a high bar for quality and speed

  • Conduct UX research to deepen understanding of the problem space and support decision-making

  • Translate insights from behavioral data, user feedback, and product analytics into clear design direction and action

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 5+ years of product design experience with a focus on growth and experimentation

  • A portfolio that demonstrates your ability to design and ship flows that drive activation, conversion, or retention

  • Strong analytical skills and comfort using data to inform and evaluate design decisions

  • Experience leading experiments and collaborating with product and data teams to define success and measure impact

  • Strategic and self-directed—you proactively define problems, shape experiments, align stakeholders, and move work forward without waiting for direction

  • Proficient in Figma and design systems, with experience using AI-powered tools to accelerate design thinking and drive efficient iteration.

  • Strong systems thinking and visual design craft—you care about clarity, usability, and polish

  • Ability to collaborate in-office weekly on Tuesdays and Wednesdays

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer

  • 💰 Ownership & Financial Security: Stock options + 401(k) with 4% match

  • 🏥 Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, dental, and vision coverage + FSA options

  • ⏰ Flexible Time: Unlimited PTO (salaried) + company holidays

  • 👶 Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service)

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesdays and Wednesdays are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Phollie L

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Eleanor Chrysomilides

  • Participate in a Talent Showcase

  • Meet Cross-functional Partners

  • Background Check + Offer Stage

  • Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply!

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Lifecycle Marketing Manager to design, launch, and optimize campaigns across multi-channel surfaces. You’ll own the strategy and execution of full-funnel customer journeys, driving engagement, activation, conversion, and lifetime customer value.

At Homebase, lifecycle isn’t just about sending messages. It’s about shaping how tens of thousands of small businesses and their employees experience our product. You’ll be hands-on in building and optimizing campaigns while consistently sharing learnings and representing lifecycle marketing to help influence decisions across the company.

  • Campaign Execution: Build and launch lifecycle campaigns across email, push, SMS, and in-app messages.

  • Audience Strategy: Develop segmentation and personalization strategies rooted in customer journey mapping and intentional design of customer experiences.

  • Experimentation: Run always-on growth experiments to drive activation, conversion, and lifetime customer value.

  • Insights & Measurement: Track performance against KPIs, extract insights, and share learnings broadly.

  • Operational Rigor: Document processes, streamline workflows, and enable cross-team alignment.

  • Team Influence: Contribute lifecycle insights in cross-team discussions and help shape how Homebase engages its customers.

  • AI & Automation: Use emerging tools to accelerate workflows and personalize at scale.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in lifecycle marketing, executing campaigns across multi-channel surfaces

  • Experience with cross-channel marketing automation platforms (Iterable or equivalent), collaboration/project management tools (e.g., Jira), and analytics platforms (e.g., Looker, Amplitude)

  • Nice to have: familiarity with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), email service providers (e.g., SendGrid), in-app messaging tools (e.g., CommandAI), and AI-powered productivity/personalization tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude)

  • Ability to interpret data, design structured experiments, and clearly communicate insights to stakeholders

  • Strong project management and prioritization skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to simplify complex ideas and adapt messaging for different audiences

  • Ability to collaborate in the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer

  • 💰 Ownership & Financial Security: Stock options + 401(k) with 4% match

  • 🏥 Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, dental, and vision coverage + FSA options

  • ⏰ Flexible Time: Unlimited PTO (salaried) + company holidays

  • 👶 Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service)

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Josh D.

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Darin T.

  • Participate in a Talent Showcase

  • Meet Cross-functional Partners

  • Background Check + Offer Stage

  • Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply! 

Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

👋 Hey, We’re Homebase

Unstoppable teams start here.

Homebase is the everything app for hourly teams—built to simplify the day-to-day and superpower local businesses. With tools for scheduling, time clocks, payroll, communication, HR, and more, we help teams stay connected and in control. Today, over 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses rely on us to make work radically easier. Together, we’ve tracked over a billion hours for 2.5+ million workers—and we’re just getting started.

At Homebase, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all candidates and do not discriminate based on any legally protected status. If you need accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know—we’re committed to ensuring fair and equitable access for all.

jobs.title: Manager, Data Science (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re hiring a Manager, Data Science who’s excited to lead a team transforming how data powers product, platform, and people at Homebase. This role is ideal for someone who wants to shape the future of applied AI at scale—leading everything from intelligent scheduling and hiring models to supporting internal sales and marketing decisions. You’ll manage a growing team of data scientists and partner with platform engineering to bring models from proof-of-concept to production.

If you’re excited about data science and AI, team leadership, and high-ownership environments, you’ll thrive here.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • Lead and grow a team of high-performing data scientists; mentor them to think like product and business owners

  • Support end-to-end delivery of models powering product features (e.g., scheduling, hiring, payroll, pricing, personalization) and internal systems (e.g., sales/marketing targeting)

  • Champion experimentation: design A/B and multivariate tests that help us move faster and make better decisions

  • Collaborate with Engineering, Product, and Design to ensure data and AI are embedded into user experiences from day one

  • Serve as a trusted thought partner to cross-functional leaders, product managers, and executive stakeholders

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 6+ years of experience in data science, applied machine learning, or AI product development

  • 2+ years in a people leadership role, mentoring and growing data scientists

  • Strong background in machine learning (optimization, traditional ML, or frontier models)

  • Proven track record of shipping ML models into production

  • Proficient in SQL and Python

  • Strong people leader with a focus on growth, empathy, and impact

  • Strong ability to partner cross-functionally with business and product teams

  • Commitment to driving outcomes in a hybrid, AI-first environment where speed and ownership matter

  • Brings curiosity, empathy, and a growth mindset to problem-solving and leadership

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer

  • 💰 Ownership & Savings: Stock options + TFSA/RRSP with 4% company match

  • 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

  • ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

  • 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Josh D.

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Kanchana P.

  • Participate in a Live Coding Interview

  • Participate in a Technical Deep Dive

  • Background Check + Offer Stage

  • Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply! 

Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

👋 Hey, We’re Homebase

Unstoppable teams start here.

Homebase is the everything app for hourly teams—built to simplify the day-to-day and superpower local businesses. With tools for scheduling, time clocks, payroll, communication, HR, and more, we help teams stay connected and in control. Today, over 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses rely on us to make work radically easier. Together, we’ve tracked over a billion hours for 2.5+ million workers—and we’re just getting started.

At Homebase, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all candidates and do not discriminate based on any legally protected status. If you need accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know—we’re committed to ensuring fair and equitable access for all.

jobs.title: Data Engineer (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Data Engineer to help us revolutionize how small businesses harness data. This isn’t just another pipeline role—it’s an opportunity to shape the foundation of AI-driven, velocity-powered insights that fuel everything we build at Homebase.

You’ll develop and maintain pipelines, models, and reporting that turn raw data into smarter products and faster solutions. This role requires both technical craft and ownership—you’ll take projects from idea to production, ensuring scalability, reliability, and measurable business impact.

  • Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines to process structured & unstructured data at scale

  • Build and maintain data models (fact, dim, SCD2, medallion/layered, marts)

  • Create reports and dashboards to support business performance analysis

  • Partner with product, data science, and analytics teams to enable AI-powered features

  • Support data architecture transformation & migration on Databricks

  • Troubleshoot and resolve data quality/performance issues quickly

  • Optimize queries and enforce best practices for reliability and velocity

  • Drive continuous improvement of workflows through automation and experimentation

  • Own projects end-to-end: planning → execution → delivery

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 5+ years of software/data engineering experience

  • Expertise in SQL (window functions, CTEs, complex joins)

  • Intermediate–advanced Python (OOP, testing, package mgmt)

  • Experience with Databricks (streaming, Unity Catalog, resource mgmt)

  • Experience with Spark (partitioning, skew handling, delta ops, Spark UI)

  • Strong knowledge of data modeling & architecture

  • Experience with DBT, Airflow, Kafka, API/S3 ingestion

  • Comfort with deploying/monitoring ML models in production (batch, streaming, real-time inference)

  • Ability to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical teammates

  • Ownership mindset: self-driven, proactive, accountable

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesdays and Wednesdays are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Mavel W.

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Paul W.

  • Participate in a Talent Showcase

  • Meet Cross-functional Partners

  • Background Check + Offer Stage

  • Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply!

jobs.title: Staff Product Manager, Growth (Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?


 📍Your Impact Starts Here

We’re looking for a Staff Product Manager, Growth to own and scale Homebase’s growth engine - converting visitors to sign-ups to engaged users to paying users to then purchasing additional products. You’ll drive the strategy, vision, and execution of onboarding and activation experiences that accelerate time-to-value, maximize engagement, and unlock long-term revenue impact. You will design and implement AI-powered customer experiences (whether agentic or otherwise), as well as design and build automation and personalization.

This is a high-visibility, high-impact role at the Staff (P5) level, designed for a seasoned product leader who can balance strategy, execution, and cross-functional influence. This role is primarily a hands-on product management role, and you will be managing a small team of 2-3 Product Managers, shaping the next generation of PM talent at Homebase.

  • Own the customer’s first 60-day experience—defining the product strategy and roadmap to accelerate onboarding, activation, and early engagement.

  • Own all product aspects of freemium->paid user and upsell conversions

  • Drive company-level impact on new customer revenue goals by partnering with Sales, Marketing, and GTM leadership.

  • Set the long-term vision and execution path for growth, onboarding, and all PLG products, including AI-enabled experiences that simplify customer tasks.

  • Lead complex cross-functional initiatives, aligning executives, GTM partners, and Product/Design/Engineering teams.

  • Manage, coach, and mentor a team of 2-3 PMs, developing their craft and ensuring alignment with Homebase’s growth priorities.

  • Establish KPIs, run experiments, and use data to drive continuous improvement in conversion, retention, and customer satisfaction.

  • Serve as a thought leader in applying AI-first approaches to product development and customer-facing workflows.

🚀 The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • 8+ years of product management experience, including significant ownership of growth, onboarding, or customer lifecycle initiatives.

  • Proven success scaling customer onboarding and engagement experiences that drove measurable revenue outcomes.

  • Experience leading cross-functional initiatives with Sales, Marketing, and GTM teams.

  • Strong track record of managing PMs.

  • Deep familiarity with AI tools for product development and material experience building AI-powered customer experiences.

  • Analytical and data-driven, with expertise in funnel analysis, activation metrics, and growth experimentation.

  • Exceptional storytelling and influence skills; able to align executives and cross-functional partners around a growth vision.

🤝  The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🎯 Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind.

  • 🏆 Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

What We Offer  

  • 💰 Ownership & Savings: Stock options + TFSA/RRSP with 4% company match

  • 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

  • ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

  • 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesdays and Wednesdays are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process

  • Meet the Talent Acquisition team, Mavel W.

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Roi C.

  • Participate in a Talent Showcase

  • Meet Cross-functional Partners

  • Background Check + Offer Stage

  • Welcome to the team, Homie 🎉

💜 Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply! 

Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

👋 Hey, We’re Homebase

Unstoppable teams start here.

Homebase is the everything app for hourly teams—built to simplify the day-to-day and superpower local businesses. With tools for scheduling, time clocks, payroll, communication, HR, and more, we help teams stay connected and in control. Today, over 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses rely on us to make work radically easier. Together, we’ve tracked over a billion hours for 2.5+ million workers—and we’re just getting started.

At Homebase, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all candidates and do not discriminate based on any legally protected status. If you need accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know—we’re committed to ensuring fair and equitable access for all.

jobs.title: Applied AI Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, Future Homie!

At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team. We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams.

We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in?

📍Your Impact Starts Here

As an Applied Scientist, you will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and other business stakeholders, to build data and data-driven features.

We welcome applicants from diverse paths — including those coming from academic research or thesis-based programs — who have developed strong ML fundamentals and curiosity through hands-on projects.

These are the key ways you’ll contribute and create impact in this role:

  • Drive advancements in LLMs and other AI technologies, navigating a rapidly evolving landscape over the coming years.

  • Leverage pre-existing models, train or fine-tune new ones, and oversee their deployment, scaling, inference, and monitoring.

  • Tackle critical business problems across diverse domains with innovative AI solutions.

  • Develop metrics to evaluate the end-user impact of ML models and ensure their alignment with business goals.

  • Effectively communicate data science experiment results to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Collaborate with data, platform, and product engineering teams to productionize models for real-time, batch, or streaming applications.

  • Support Product, Engineering, and leadership teams with data-driven decision-making.

🚀 The Foundation for Success – These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role:

  • A strong foundational understanding of ML principles.

  • Experience working with LLMs in industry or academia — whether through coursework, a thesis, or hands-on research.

  • Adaptability to learn and evolve as newer AI models emerge.

  • Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation and model development.

  • The ability to break down complex business problems into manageable components.

  • Exceptional problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

🤝 The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other.

  • 💡 Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity.

  • ⚡ Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day.

  • 🏅 Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other.

  • 🏥 Health & Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision for you and your dependents

  • ⏰ Time Flexibility: Flex time off + company holidays + designated focus periods

  • 👶 Family Support: Maternity/Parental Leave EI top-up support offered (after 6 months of service)

  • 🌟 Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly

  • 🛡️ Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage

  • 🍽️ Workspace Perks: Meals provided, team offsites, and Customer Days

  • 💼 Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together.

What to Expect During the Interview Process (please add the names and LinkedIn profiles of the hiring team)

  • Meet the Hiring Manager, Kanchana P.

  • Participate in a Talent Showcase
